result.execSummary:
All charges against Billy Verdell Rogers Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Billy Verdell Rogers Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion & Order to Dismiss

9:39 AM Defendant Billy Verdell Rogers Jr. not in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Billy Verdell Rogers Jr.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF443 and 22CF31 and 21FO1036. Court notes defendant signed notice for the hearing. Attorney Nelsen has no information on nonappearance. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant, WI and MN and forfeiture of any bond. Court grants warrant and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. Court finds defendant in default, orders standard fine with 60 days to pay.

9:38 AM Defendant Billy Verdell Rogers in court.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21FO1036, 21CF443, and 22CF31. Attorney Nelsen notes that the State has sent and offer, defendant has asked for counter offer. State will not accept counter offer. Defendant is looking for information on drug court. Attorney Nelsen indicates that matters could be set for trial. State asks for another status, notes that offer will be off if matter is set for trial. Court notes matter will be set for trial if still unresolved.

03:09 PM Defendant Billy Verdell Rogers in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant- Qualifies for PD but hasn't been notified yet of who
Att Craker- He had Att Gramstrup before, is reaching out to him to see if he will represent
Court reviews time waiver. 
Defendant waives time limits
Court sets date
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
no operating a motor vehicle without valid license or permit.

02:31 PM Defendant Billy Verdell Rogers in court.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court accepts the plea of not guilty and will set matter for Prelim on Count 1.  States request on bail: $250 cash bail with conditions of   No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. Defendant is currently out on felony bail and has $1500 cash bail posted on that case. State is concerned about the lack of Douglas County ties. State gives prior criminal history that are entirely in Minnesota. State does recognize that defendant does appear voluntarily here today. 
Defendant argues bail. Defendant indicates he never received any documentation. Defendant is unable to post money right now, but needs to make a phone call. 
Court Orders $1000 signature bond with conditions of  No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Defendant would like to apply for Public Defender. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm for Attorney Check
